content: Form I-129 is used by employers to petition U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) for a nonimmigrant worker to come temporarily to the United States to perform services or labor or to receive training. The form is used for various nonimmigrant classifications, such as H-1B, L-1, and O-1. The petition must be filed by the employer and must be accompanied by the correct fee. The processing time for the form varies depending on the specific circumstances of each case and additional information or an interview may be requested. Employers should consult the appropriate regulatory provisions in 8 CFR that relate to the nonimmigrant classification sought. The form should be filed no more than 6 months prior to the date employment is scheduled to begin. The form can be filed in person or through the mail and the location of filing can be found on the USCIS website.
